results.justification: The paper explicitly states the research methodology: "In this work, we demonstrated a novel approach for evaluating LLM-generated artifacts based on student learning data."
The paper provides a detailed step-by-step description of the study design, from data collection and LLM prompting to distractor evaluation (Sections 4 and 5).
The paper states: "The dataset of student responses is not publicly available and was provided by the tool’s developer upon our request."
The paper provides a clear justification for not sharing the data: privacy concerns and the data being provided by the tool's developer.

The paper describes the data collected (student identifier, course ID, challenge ID, etc.) and provides summary statistics (Table 1). It also details the data cleaning process (excluding attempts after a correct answer).
Data collection methods are fully described, including the source (PCEX system), the type of data collected (student responses), and the time period (Fall 2017 to Spring 2023).
The paper does not mention sharing the analysis code.
Since the code is not mentioned, there is no justification for not sharing it.
The paper does not mention sharing code for data preparation.
Statistical tests (averages, standard deviations) and models (matching LLM-generated distractors to human-authored ones) are described.
Effect sizes (match rates), standard deviations, and descriptive statistics are reported throughout the results section.
The authors provide subjective context and interpretation when labeling non-matched distractors (Nonsense, Unnecessary statements, Correct answer, Distractor).
The data coding process (labeling non-matched distractors) and analysis (inter-rater agreement) are clearly described.
Results are presented clearly using tables (Table 1), figures (Figures 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13), and descriptive text.
The paper discusses limitations such as the limited dataset size, uneven topic distribution, and vague problem statements (Section 6).
The paper does not contain a link to a preregistration.
